summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing the production of discovery materials. The production includes search warrant returns and data from numerous electronic devices, including an iPhone seized from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his arrest in 2019. The letter outlines the government's ongoing discovery obligations and provides a chart listing the devices searched.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of the discovery production letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual from whom an iPhone (Subject Device-2) was seized by law enforcement at the time of his arrest in 2019. Data from this device is part of the discovery production.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Law enforcement seized an iPhone from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his arrest.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

events.title: Initial Discovery Production
events.description: The government produced an initial set of responsive materials from seized electronic devices to the defense.

events.title: Completion of Responsiveness Review
events.description: The government completed its responsiveness review of images from Jeffrey Epstein's iPhone (Subject Device-2) due to prior technical difficulties.

events.title: Supplemental Discovery Production
events.description: The government produced additional discovery materials, including a hard drive and CD containing search warrant returns and data from numerous devices, to defense counsel.

keyFacts: The document confirms that an iPhone (Subject Device-2) was seized from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his arrest in 2019, and data from it was part of discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The government produced a massive volume of discovery materials, indexed with control numbers spanning from SDNY_GM_00536837 to SDNY_GM_02742043, primarily consisting of search warrant returns.

A chart lists 62 subject devices searched pursuant to warrants; responsive material was produced from many, but no responsive material was found on several devices, and one device (Subject Device-15) could not be accessed by the FBI.
The production and letter are governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, designating certain materials as confidential.
The letter is from Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss to multiple defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, outlining ongoing discovery obligations.
